data.title: Mirja Birgitan esite 3.2.2017
data.meta_description: Mirja Birgitan esite 3.2.2017 - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
1. ARShopart of Mirja Birgitta mirja.nuutinen@arshop.fi +358 40 5303192 arshop.fi saatchiart.com/MirjaBirgitta Collections Animal Dreams Archaic Dreams Birth of Light Gardener's Dreams Space Dreams Urban Dreams Zen Series of Dreams is a project that has spanned over 10 years and is still marching forward with my collection of abstract works growing at steady pace. The series has been exhibited on multiple occasions. One of my main themes is time. In particular I use a concept that I like to term Vertical Time. Vertical Time is a single layered point upon which lays the past, the present and the future. This layered dimension of depth is best expressed by using digital techniques. Vertical time is a research that evolved from my 2005 series Archaic Dreams. In that series I blended and fused my photographs of ancient Scandinavian rock paintings, carvings, northern shamanistic symbols together with images of present day wildlife and nature. A person may notice that vertical time is a reoccurring theme that runs throughout my other layered abstract artworks. These pieces feature my personal collection of old paintings intertwined with modern pieces and photographs. They represent and narrate my long emotional and experimental journey as a human being. Exhibition "Gardener's Dreams" in Äänekoski Hoikkassali Gallery 2016

2. Techiques Creativity has followed along side of me for almost my entire life. A paintbrush has been in my hand since my childhood, and a camera, with the world as my canvas for the last twenty years. Digital techniques have been one of my mediums also for the last two decades. Most of my artworks are digital collages. The process to create a final version of my artwork can take quite a long time. It all starts with an idea. After that I start to gather material, this could involve for example going to photograph Scandinavian rock art as I did for Archaic Dreams series. Materials can be almost anything – hand drawings and paintings, my photos and even sometimes vector graphics. The most important thing is that they are my own unique creation. The final stage of my creative process involves a lot of choices and decisions between slight variations in tonalities and saturations that will result in the final version. I have used the artist name Mirja Birgitta since 2015 and I write also an artist blog Arshop in my native Finnish language. I have five hand-signed museum quality prints of each piece available. They are also available standard prints with my logo from Saatchiart's online gallery.
